question.text: A variable, the opposite external potential <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mi>ext</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></math> is applied to the cell <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>|</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>∥</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>|</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi></math>, of potential <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>. When <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><mn>1.1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>1.1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math>, respectively electrons flow from

options.text: anode to cathode in both the cases.
anode to cathode and cathode to anode.
cathode to anode and anode to cathode.
cathode to anode in both cases.

solution.text:
For a Daniel cell,

Ecell=0.34-(-0.76)=1.10 V.

When Eext<1.10 V, electrons flow from anode to cathode in the external circuit.

When Eext>1.10 V, electrons flow from cathode to anode in the external circuit (reverse reaction).
